newsitem.title: USA: AEP, Sears sign energy service pact.
newsitem.headline: AEP, Sears sign energy service pact.

text.p: American Electric Power (AEP) said Thursday it was chosen by U.S. retail giant Sears, Roebuck and Co to provide energy management services to Sears' stores and other facilities in the Midwest and Ohio River valley.

AEP, one of eight regional power suppliers chosen by Sears, said it will be responsible for Sears stores and warehouses in parts of Ohio, Indiana, Michigan, Illinois, Kentucky, Pennsylvania, Virginia and West Virginia.
As part of the regional alliance, AEP said it will provide services to help Sears improve energy efficiency in an environmentally responsible manner.

The types of services were expected to include energy audits, upgrading lighting, energy efficient heating, ventilation and cooling systems, budget forecasting, insulation upgrades, and energy control systems, AEP said.
An AEP spokeswoman declined to disclose the value of the deal and said it was too early to estimate its overall savings to Sears.
